title: Get The Girl
description: Andy goes to Tallahassee to tell Erin that he loves her and needs her to return to Scranton. Meanwhile, Nellie shows up in Scranton and tries to claim Andy's manager position by offering everyone raises.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [telephone ringing] This is Pam. Oh my God, are you sure? Uh, okay. Okay, um, we'll be right there. Everybody, the balloon is falling.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's this balloon that has been floating in the rafters of the warehouse for, like, ever. And, okay, it's not -- it doesn't sound cool. You just have to see it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I guess it doesn't look that cool either. But, it's been up there a long time, so it's become a pretty big deal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. It's the end of an era.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did a good job, Buddy. Now it's time to come home.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I remember when that balloon went up there. I was still with Gil. We were so happy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: When that went up there, I had hair like Rapunzel.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How long do you think it's been up there, Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I just remember pushing aside my silky bangs to say, "Look, a balloon."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My warcraft clan was still on speaking terms.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: My kid didn't have a face tattoo.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I was still thinking of going back to school.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I was still just a paper salesman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well this has been fun, Pam. Thanks for calling us all down here. [everyone sighs]

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Kill the balloon. Kill the balloon. Kill the balloon. Kill the balloon. Kill the balloon. [pops loudly] [cheers and applause]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. So they accidentally gave us an extra egg sandwich this morning. Who wants it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: oooh

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right here.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Allow me to solve your problem, then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nellie

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mmm. [bites sandwich] Oh, that is disgusting. Do you call that a King James breakfast pie?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What brings you to town?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Certainly not the Harry Houdini Museum. What a nobody. Oh look, some Hungarian just found their way out of a sack. Let's build a shrine. No, I've come to work here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How could Robert transfer Nellie here after the Sabre store debacle? She stinks of failure. The fact that she could show her face around here is an embarrassment. I should know. I'm in an identical situation.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Robert did say you'd be joining us. Welcome. I'm Tony.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I- I said I'm Tony. Okay I made a mistake. I thought it might go unnoticed. But uh, I'm Toby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You messed up saying your name?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It happens, okay? Uh, so let's just find an empty desk for you, and uh, I'm sure Robert will be with you as soon as he gets in.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That one looks empty.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that's Andy's office.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, is it?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I have one simple philosophy in business: if the seat is open, the job is open. It's how I came to briefly race a formula one car. The three slowest laps ever recorded.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Another beautiful day in Tallahassee. Ooh. Good morning, Alonzo.

quotes.speaker: Alonzo
quotes.text: Good morning Erin. [driving by delivering newspapers]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: How are you? How's your family doing?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Look at this place! Five rooms, and I get to clean them all. That's right. I'm a maid for an old lady. Her grandson's staying with us too because he ran out of money. [chuckles] Listen to me, bragging away.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Nellie.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Robert.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: How are you adjusting to life in Scranton so far?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So far, so good.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Water pressure in the hotel is marvelous.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Ah, well, it is astounding what a difference that can make, isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Now. Let's find you something fun to do here, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, I've already found it. I am manager, a natural next step. It fits like a glove.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: We have a manager.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Do you really? Because it is 10:00. I've been in this chair for an hour, and no other manager has come and sat in my lap.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Excuse me, has anyone seen Andy this morning?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Huh. Yeah, that's weird. He's usually here by now. Right guys?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, it's Robert. Why aren't you at work?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Robert. Ah, I really wish I could come in to work today, but I'm super sick.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I don't care, I don't care. Please come to work immediately.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, I'll try to come in even though I'm really sick with the...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [standing in ocean] ...Florida Flu.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: He just hung up on me mid-sentence.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm in Florida to get Erin. As soon as I heard she wasn't coming back to Scranton, I jumped straight in my car and drove straight down till I hit the ocean. My heart is my map. Turns out, Tallahassee is about 200 miles inland, so I overshot a good amount. But still, not bad for a heart map right? [picking up dead fish] Oh, no. Thanks a lot, BP.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Not much we can do about this until he gets here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can't you do something about this?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Sometimes the flowers arrange themselves, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: -Right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is going on? And where's Andy? And what is going on?

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: Erin, you got a package.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm in the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Glenn
quotes.text: Where's the postage? I mean, there's no shipping label.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: Did you wash your hands?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: {Erin} and {Irene}
quotes.text: [screaming as Andy busts out of box]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Here I am; Signed, sealed, delivered; I'm yours!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy, what are you doing here? It's great to see you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, I am here to take you back to Scranton. Because I love you and I want to be with you.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: Where's the ring?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hm?

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: Where's the ring, Lancelot?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh, would you guys mind if we talked privately for a second? Sorry, Glenn.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Um, Andy... I am so happy to see you. But I'm not coming back with you.

quotes.speaker: Glenn
quotes.text: [whispering off screen] Why won't she go with him?

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: [whispering] I don't know. Maybe it's 'cause he's not that handsome.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey... don't listen.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So what is going on? That does seem to be the question, doesn't it? [in American accent] Hey, this is messed up, bro. Who is this weird lady? [normal voice] I know. It's a lot. So, who knows what's going on? Anyone? You, yes. Wait, I am very good at intuiting names. Is it... chumbo?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think it's a cross between Dumbo and Jumbo, with a hint of chubby. It's not a name.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So no one can tell me what's going on. Well, let me illuminate things for you. We are getting to know each other. [in American accent] But why, m'lady? [in normal voice] Because I am your new manager.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Robert, is Nellie our new manager?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [laughs] This is an odd situation. But it's very interesting how it's playing out.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: We live in this world of routines and rhythms. Kevin ate someone's lunch. Phyllis has a new necklace. Who is this woman?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I came in here simply trying to get to know you, learn your names, maybe have someone teach me the company song. And what I got in return was nothing but disrespect. You leave me no choice but to get to know you in a more intimate way.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hot tub party?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Performance reviews.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How can you give us performance reviews if you don't know us?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: On first impressions, so I recommend smiling. It goes a long way with me.

quotes.speaker: Glenn
quotes.text: Erin, you really nailed the hot dogs today.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. I've been re-using the hot dog water so it gets more flavor. It's only going to keep getting better.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: So, Andrew, how does your skinny brunette girlfriend Jessica feel about you visiting your ex-girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, we're not really dating anymore, so... basically, I mean, I just have to cross a few Ts and dot a few I's, you know.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So you came to get me, but you still have a girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: I think you should leave, young man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right. Technically, yes, I am still technically dating Jessica. But when I realized that I wanted you back, I just jumped in the car and I drove down here, and I didn't want to stop until I saw you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You didn't even stop to pee? Gross.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Any luck?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. He just keeps letting all the calls go to voicemail.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on phone message, singing] Please leave a message for Andy Bernard, include your na-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, you're doing so good. Oh my God, you're superman over there. [Andy's phone vibrating]

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: You should take it. It's probably your girlfriend wondering where you are.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nope. It's just work. Not important. You know, I can really feel this is my quads, I can tell I'm getting stronger.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: You really wouldn't feel those kinds of results after one session.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know. [phone vibrating] Just let it vibrate. It's fine.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: You could put it on silent.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't think it does that.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: Just go to preferences, then click -

quotes.speaker: Glenn
quotes.text: [answering Andy's phone] Proctology.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, where are you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I- I'm home in bed. I've been in bed all day. I got the- I got the serious poops, man.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: He's here in Tallahassee, trying to turn my life upside down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? You're in Florida? Andy, Nellie Bertram's trying to take your job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you mean, take my job?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Like, set up camp in your office and is calling herself the manager.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay... Jim, I really appreciate you looking out for me, but I'm not coming home without Erin. So I'll talk to you later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guys, we cannot do these performance reviews, okay? If we go into them, you're basically accepting Nellie as your manager, and trust me, you do not want her as your manager.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Trust you? The way Pam trusted you to provide for her so she wouldn't have to work?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I like working here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, should she be our manager?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wouldn't let her manage a celery farm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Those who can't farm, farm celery.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And when was the last time Dwight and I agreed on anything ever? [clears throat]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: All right. Let's get going. First up, it is the woman with the beautiful fingernails and the tiny feet, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Nellie, I'm sorry, but I don't feel comfortable being evaluated by someone I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh. Oh, okay. I understand. Let me show you how these are gonna go. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I refuse to be judged by someone that I do not respect. I lost respect for you in Florida. If it was up to me, you would be in jail forever.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight, I have completed your evaluation. You're getting a raise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight, you carry this company on your massive shoulders. You are our Atlas, and for that do you not think you deserve a raise?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's no limit to what I think I deserve.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Then you accept it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Five percent. No less.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Absolutely not. Seven percent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Six percent, I know my worth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The raise isn't real.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Money isn't real ever since we got off the gold standard.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So Phyllis, now you know the rules of the game. Would you care to have a go? I'm fairly certain you're going to like it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So, Phyllis, I have been very impressed with you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. The way you conquered your fear and came in here, and now the way you sit there... all very impressive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um... are you aware that Nellie is giving out raises?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I am not. Huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. She gave one to Dwight, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Let me guess, you want one too? Take the family to Disneytown?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Land. World. Uh, it's not that I don't want a- well, yes, I guess I'd take a raise. That's not what I'm saying. That's not- sorry.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Jim, I told Andy to come in, and yet he is still not in. By contrast, Nellie Bertram saw a vacuum and filled it. To make no mention of her business experience or her relationship with Jo Bennett, my boss.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Jim, would you prefer a nature metaphor or a sexual metaphor?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, god, nature, please.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: When two animals are having sex, one of them...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [exhales sharply]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: ... is communicating a message to the other. Nothing is mutua- this isn't very helpful. You're gonna want to hear the sexual metaphor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Was that not the-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: All life is sex. And all sex is competition.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: And there are no rules to that game. That wasn't so perverted, now was it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Was that it? No, that wasn't bad.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: My point is, there is one person in charge of every office in America, and that person is Charles Darwin. In the end, doesn't he decide who the manager is?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. I would've said no.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mm, let's see, review, review, review. Yes, good stuff. Here you go, have a raise.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean, if we go in there and take these raises, what are we saying? That it's okay for someone to just take someone else's job? Shouldn't work like that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you know what? Nellie's right. That is exactly how it should work. Darryl, this office is mine now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. Yes, sorry too late. I'm here. This is mine. Back off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Darryl grabbing him by his hair, dragging him from office] Ow! Ow, ow, ow. Ow, ow, ow, Ow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [panting] Well fought. I accept the outcome.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Touch me and I'll sue.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I've heard that's amazing when it works.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, if I had my own-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy, I care about you and I think-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: -sorry, you go.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I was just going to say that, if I had my own fountain, it would be two frogs that are spitting into each other's mouth. It's just stupid. What were you going to say?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy, you broke my heart. Do you know what it feels like to be constantly rejected by you and to have to watch you date someone else?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You broke my heart too.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You broke my heart more recently and more often. And I think at some point, in my head, it just sort of clicked that we're not meant to be.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm so sorry that we have not loved each other at the same time.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So, Pamela, I'm going to start this review, not by telling you what you lack, but rather, asking you what it is you want.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? Okay, well, um, I like consistency in the manager's position, no weird silent coups. Stuff like that. I'm easy.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That's not really what you want. What you want is a good night's sleep, working mother of two.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Whoa, that's kind of condescending. Would you say something like that to Jim?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Does Jim have to breastfeed? Did Jim carry around those babies for- what is it? 12 months? Be honest, does Jim really get up in the night?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I mean, the only reason he doesn't is because I'm breastfeeding, and Phillip doesn't like a bottle.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You must be exhausted. Fancy a nap?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Go on. Have a nap. Lie down right here. There's a blanket in here. I used it earlier myself. Dreamt I could breathe underwater like Jacques Cousteau. No one will know. I'll wake you up. And when you wake up, you will earn more money.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think... you're a witch.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I think you're amazing. You know that, right? Go on, say it: "I'm amazing."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [drowsily] I'm amazing. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: Erin, I think you're making a big mistake right now. Andy is a nice boy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really? 'cause you've been kind of a B to him all afternoon.

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: I was protecting you because I thought he was no good. But I can tell you really like him. And he's willing to lose his job for you, in this economy with Europe on the brink-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Irene, what would you do without me?

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: We're not your concern, sweetheart. Besides, Glenn's going to sue Home Depot.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Irene
quotes.text: He got his foreskin caught in some lawn furniture.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Jim, time for your review.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it's not, because you don't really work here.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Why are you so staunchly defending your friend, who has abandoned you? Wouldn't you rather come talk with me? Maybe definitely get a raise?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, that's the thing. I don't know if you can even give raises.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Jim, have you ever heard of a character named Tinkerbell?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I'm Tinkerbell.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mm-hm. I'm a magical fairy who floated into your office to bring a little bit of magic into your lives, to give you all raises.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: And we are grateful.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: But here's the thing about Tinkerbell, Jim. Everyone has to believe in her or she doesn't exist.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She dies.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: She dies! Now who here believes in Tinkerbell?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's see it. Show of hands.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I do. [applause] Come on everyone...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, guys, stop.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I already spent the money.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Come on Jim, you're killing her!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: We believe! We believe!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Look at this wonderful recognition of Nellie's leadership. I believe. [applause continues]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That did not go how I wanted it to. Ugh. I have a whole ton of Erin's favorite food for the drive back, eggplant parm. [tosses it out car window] It's biodegradable. Animals will eat it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy wait! [running down street] Andy! Andy wait! Don't go! Andy I love you! Stop! Oh, this is the wrong Prius. I don't love you. I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy. [horns honking as they kiss in the street]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Let's get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait, we have to go back and get your stuff.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, I don't have any stuff.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Like your toothbrush and stuff.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't have one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You don't have a toothbrush?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How do you not have a toothbrush?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I just... there's always one around.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You just use whichever one is sitting there?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I always find one. Have you ever heard of buying a toothbrush?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of course. I own my toothbrush.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I grew up poor. I had little formal education. No real skills. I don't work especially hard, and most of my ideas are either unoriginal or total crap. And yet, I walked right into a job for which I was ill-prepared, ill-suited, and somebody else already had, and I got it. If you ask me, that's the American dream right there. Anything can happen to anyone. It's just random.
